episode_summary: This episode of "No Such Thing As A Fish" features discussions on a variety of topics including the history of BBC radio presenters, the cultural impact of Kenny G's music in China, the intense rivalry between 19th-century paleontologists, and the translation of computer terms in different languages.

facts.fact: The first BBC radio presenter with a northern accent was given the job to make it more difficult for the Nazis to impersonate news readers.
In China, if you want to empty a building full of people, you play the song 'Going Home' by Kenny G.
The two leading paleontologists in the 19th century used to destroy their fossil sites after excavating them so that their rival wasn't able to find anything on them.

Mozilla Firefox translates its computer systems into hundreds of different languages, but lots of the metaphors don't translate, so in Senegal, in the Fula language, a computer crash is known as a hooky, which means a cow falling over but not dying.
